  • डिजिटल भुगतान प्रणाली: वे तंत्र जिनके माध्यम से लेनदेन इलेक्ट्रॉनिक रूप से किए जाते हैं, जैसे कि मोबाइल वॉलेट, ऑनलाइन बैंकिंग और UPI, आदि।
121
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
2017 में गृह मंत्रालय द्वारा गठित द्वीप विकास एजेंसी (IDA), जो भारत के द्वीपों के सतत विकास को बढ़ावा देने के लिए गठित की गई थी, के संयोजक के रूप में कौन कार्य करता है?
केंद्रीय पर्यावरण, वन और जलवायु परिवर्तन मंत्री
नीति आयोग के सीईओ
भारत के प्रधानमंत्री
गृह राज्य मंत्री
कैबिनेट सचिव
Solution

सही उत्तर नीति आयोग के सीईओ है।

समाचार में

  • अंडमान और निकोबार द्वीप समूह और लक्षद्वीप में चल रही विकास पहलों की प्रगति की समीक्षा करने के लिए द्वीप विकास एजेंसी (IDA) की 7वीं बैठक आयोजित की गई थी।

मुख्य बिंदु

  • भारत के द्वीपों के सतत विकास को बढ़ावा देने के लिए 1 जून 2017 को गृह मंत्रालय द्वारा द्वीप विकास एजेंसी (IDA) का गठन किया गया था।
  • भारत के गृह मंत्री IDA के अध्यक्ष के रूप में कार्य करते हैं।
  • नीति आयोग के सीईओ IDA के संयोजक के रूप में कार्य करते हैं।
  • नीति आयोग द्वीपों के समग्र और सतत विकास का मार्गदर्शन करने के लिए जिम्मेदार है।

अतिरिक्त जानकारी

  • विकास पर ध्यान केंद्रित करने के क्षेत्र
    • पर्यटन और बुनियादी ढाँचे का विकास
    • मत्स्य पालन और समुद्री संसाधन
    • नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा परियोजनाएँ
  • हालिया घटनाक्रम
    • पारिस्थितिक पर्यटन और बंदरगाह संपर्क में विभिन्न विकास परियोजनाओं के लिए लक्षद्वीप और अंडमान और निकोबार द्वीप समूह की पहचान की गई है।
  • सतत विकास लक्ष्य
    • पारिस्थितिक प्रभाव को कम करना और नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा को अपनाने को बढ़ावा देना।
122
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s

संसद भाषिणी पहल के संबंध में निम्नलिखित कथनों पर विचार करें:

  1. यह पहल बहुभाषी पहुँच सुनिश्चित करने के लिए संसदीय बहसों और दस्तावेजों का कई भारतीय भाषाओं में सहज अनुवाद प्रदान करने का लक्ष्य रखती है।
  2. लोकसभा सचिवालय ने संसदीय कार्य मंत्रालय के साथ मिलकर संसद भाषिणी पहल को विकसित किया।
  3. शोधकर्ताओं को किसी भी भाषा में अनुवादित लोकसभा बहसों तक पहुँच प्रदान करने के लिए AI कोश डेटासेट बनाया जा रहा है।

उपरोक्त में से कौन सा/से कथन सही है/हैं?

केवल 1 और 2
केवल 2
केवल 1 और 3
केवल 3
केवल 1 
Solution

सही उत्तर कथन 1 और कथन 3 है।

  • कथन 1 सही है क्योंकि संसद भाषिणी पहल का उद्देश्य संसदीय बहसों, समिति रिपोर्टों और विधायी दस्तावेजों का कई भारतीय भाषाओं में सहज अनुवाद प्रदान करना है, जिससे सभी नागरिकों के लिए समावेशिता और पहुँच सुनिश्चित होती है।
  • कथन 2 गलत है क्योंकि लोकसभा सचिवालय ने संसदीय कार्य मंत्रालय के साथ नहीं, बल्कि इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स और सूचना प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय (MeitY) के साथ मिलकर संसद भाषिणी पहल को विकसित किया है।
  • कथन 3 सही है क्योंकि शोधकर्ताओं को कई भाषाओं में अनुवादित लोकसभा बहसों तक पहुँच प्रदान करने के लिए AI कोश डेटासेट बनाया जा रहा है, जिससे कई भाषाओं में संसदीय कॉर्पस का अधिक कुशल उपयोग संभव हो सकेगा।

In News

  • लोकसभा सचिवालय द्वारा MeitY के सहयोग से विकसित संसद भाषिणी पहल का उद्देश्य AI-संचालित उपकरणों और बहुभाषी समर्थन के माध्यम से संसदीय प्रलेखन में क्रांति लाना है।

Key Points

  • उद्देश्य: इस पहल का उद्देश्य AI-आधारित अनुवाद और ट्रांसक्रिप्शन उपकरणों का उपयोग करके बहुभाषी पहुँच को बढ़ाना और संसदीय प्रक्रियाओं को सुव्यवस्थित करना है।
  • सहयोग: इस पहल को विकसित करने के लिए लोकसभा सचिवालय ने इलेक्ट्रॉनिक्स और सूचना प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय (MeitY) के साथ भागीदारी की है।
  • AI कोश डेटासेट: शोधकर्ताओं को विभिन्न भाषाओं में अनुवादित संसदीय बहसों तक पहुँच प्रदान करने के लिए "AI कोश" नामक एक बड़ा डेटासेट बनाया जा रहा है।

Additional Information

  • AI-संचालित उपकरण: इस पहल में स्पीच-टू-टेक्स्ट ट्रांसक्रिप्शन, स्पीच-टू-स्पीच अनुवाद और प्रक्रियात्मक नियमों और दस्तावेजों के कुशल पुनर्प्राप्ति के लिए एक इंटरैक्टिव चैटबॉट शामिल है।
  • प्रभाव: इस पहल से भाषाई विविधता को बढ़ावा देकर, प्रलेखन को अनुकूलित करके और शासन में जनता की भागीदारी में सुधार करके संसदीय प्रक्रियाओं में परिवर्तन की उम्मीद है।
123
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
भारत में अपनी वित्तीय सेवाओं का विस्तार करने के लिए, ऑस्ट्रेलियाई फिनटेक कंपनी फाइंडी ने अपनी सहायक कंपनी ट्रांजेक्शन सॉल्यूशंस इंटरनेशनल (इंडिया) प्राइवेट लिमिटेड के माध्यम से टाटा कम्युनिकेशंस से ₹330 करोड़ में __________ का अधिग्रहण किया, जिसमें इंटरचेंज दर समायोजन से जुड़े अतिरिक्त ₹75 करोड़ भी शामिल हैं।
टाटा कम्युनिकेशंस पेमेंट सॉल्यूशंस लिमिटेड (टीसीपीएसएल)
टाटा कंसल्टेंसी सर्विसेज (टीसीएस)
टाटा कैपिटल फाइनेंशियल सर्विसेज लिमिटेड
टाटा एसेट मैनेजमेंट लिमिटेड
टाटा सिक्योरिटीज लिमिटेड
Solution

सही उत्तर टाटा कम्युनिकेशंस पेमेंट सॉल्यूशंस लिमिटेड (टीसीपीएसएल) है।

समाचार में

  • भारतीय रिजर्व बैंक (आरबीआई) ने टाटा कम्युनिकेशंस की टाटा कम्युनिकेशंस पेमेंट सॉल्यूशंस लिमिटेड (टीसीपीएसएल) में अपनी पूरी हिस्सेदारी ऑस्ट्रेलियाई फिनटेक फर्म फाइंडी की सहायक कंपनी ट्रांजेक्शन सॉल्यूशंस इंटरनेशनल (इंडिया) प्राइवेट लिमिटेड (टीएसआई) को 330 करोड़ रुपये में बेचने की योजना को मंजूरी दे दी, जिसमें इंटरचेंज रेट समायोजन से जुड़े अतिरिक्त 75 करोड़ रुपये भी शामिल हैं।

प्रमुख बिंदु

  • अधिग्रहण में टीसीपीएसएल का व्हाइट-लेबल एटीएम प्लेटफॉर्म, डब्ल्यूएलए लाइसेंस और भुगतान स्विच शामिल हैं, जिससे भारत में फाइंडी के एटीएम नेटवर्क का विस्तार होगा।
  • फाइंडी 4,600 से अधिक परिचालनरत इंडिकैश एटीएम को एकीकृत करेगा तथा अतिरिक्त 3,000 एटीएम तक पहुंच प्राप्त करेगा, जिससे भारत में इसका कुल एटीएम नेटवर्क 12,000 से अधिक हो जाएगा।
  • टीएसआई वर्तमान में विभिन्न बैंकों के लिए 7,500 से अधिक ब्राउन-लेबल एटीएम संचालित करता है और 10,000 से अधिक व्हाइट-लेबल एटीएम के बैक-एंड परिचालन का प्रबंधन करता है।
  • यह अधिग्रहण, अपने व्यापक व्यापारिक नेटवर्क का लाभ उठाकर, विशेष रूप से ग्रामीण और अर्ध-शहरी क्षेत्रों में वित्तीय समावेशन को बढ़ाने की फाइंडी की रणनीति के अनुरूप है।

अतिरिक्त जानकारी

  • व्हाइट-लेबल एटीएम (WLA)
    • गैर-बैंकिंग संस्थाओं के स्वामित्व और संचालन वाले एटीएम, जो कई बैंकों के ग्राहकों के लिए सुलभ हैं, का उद्देश्य पारंपरिक बैंक शाखाओं से परे बैंकिंग पहुंच का विस्तार करना है।
  • ब्राउन-लेबल एटीएम
    • एटीएम निजी ऑपरेटरों के स्वामित्व में होते हैं, लेकिन बैंक के ब्रांड और नेटवर्क के तहत संचालित होते हैं, जहां हार्डवेयर का स्वामित्व सेवा प्रदाता के पास होता है, और नकदी प्रबंधन और नेटवर्क कनेक्टिविटी बैंक द्वारा प्रदान की जाती है।
  • विनिमय दर समायोजन
    • यह एक शुल्क है जो बैंक अपने ग्राहकों द्वारा गैर-बैंक एटीएम पर किए गए लेनदेन के लिए एटीएम ऑपरेटरों को देते हैं, जो एटीएम ऑपरेटरों के राजस्व मॉडल को प्रभावित करता है।
  • फाइंडीपे
    • भारत में फाइंडी द्वारा संचालित एक व्यापारी-आधारित डिजिटल भुगतान नेटवर्क, जिसका उद्देश्य बेहतर पहुंच और समावेशन के लिए विभिन्न वित्तीय सेवाओं को एकीकृत करना है।
124
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
राष्ट्रीय खेल 2025 के संबंध में निम्नलिखित कथनों पर विचार करें:
  1. उत्तराखंड में आयोजित राष्ट्रीय खेल 2025 के लिए शुभंकर का नाम "मौली" है, जो हिमालयी मोनाल, उत्तराखंड के राज्य पक्षी से प्रेरित है।
  2. आधिकारिक मशाल का नाम "तेजस्विनी" है।
  3. सेवा खेल नियंत्रण बोर्ड (SSCB) ने 68 स्वर्ण पदकों के साथ समग्र खिताब जीता।
  4. महाराष्ट्र ने कुल पदकों की सर्वाधिक संख्या के साथ पदक तालिका में पहला स्थान प्राप्त किया।
उपरोक्त में से कितने कथन सही हैं?
केवल एक
केवल दो
केवल तीन
सभी चार
उपर्युक्त में से कोई नहीं
Solution

सही उत्तर केवल तीन है।

In News

  • राष्ट्रीय खेल 2025 उत्तराखंड में आयोजित किए गए थे।
  • राष्ट्रीय खेल 2025 के लिए शुभंकर का नाम मौली है, जो हिमालयी मोनाल, उत्तराखंड के राज्य पक्षी से प्रेरित है।
  • सेवा खेल नियंत्रण बोर्ड (SSCB) ने 68 स्वर्ण पदकों और कुल 121 पदकों के साथ समग्र खिताब जीता।
  • महाराष्ट्र ने सबसे अधिक पदक (201 पदक) जीतने के बावजूद, दूसरा स्थान प्राप्त किया क्योंकि उन्होंने केवल 54 स्वर्ण पदक जीते।
  • खेलों में 28 राज्य, 8 केंद्र शासित प्रदेश और SSCB ने 34 खेलों में प्रतिस्पर्धा की।

Key Points

  • कथन 1 सही है:
    • राष्ट्रीय खेलों का 38वां संस्करण उत्तराखंड द्वारा आयोजित किया गया था।
    • राष्ट्रीय खेल 2025 के लिए शुभंकर का नाम मौली है, जो हिमालयी मोनाल, उत्तराखंड के राज्य पक्षी से प्रेरित है।
  • कथन 2 सही है: 38वें राष्ट्रीय खेलों की आधिकारिक मशाल, जिसका नाम तेजस्विनी है, शक्ति, प्रेरणा और उत्कृष्टता की अथक खोज का प्रतिनिधित्व करती है।
  • कथन 3 सही है: सेवा खेल नियंत्रण बोर्ड ने 68 स्वर्ण, 26 रजत और 27 कांस्य पदक के साथ राष्ट्रीय खेल 2025 का खिताब जीता, जिससे कुल 121 पदक हुए।
  • कथन 4 गलत है: महाराष्ट्र के पास सबसे अधिक कुल पदक (201 पदक) थे, लेकिन दूसरा स्थान प्राप्त किया क्योंकि उन्होंने 54 स्वर्ण पदक जीते, जबकि SSCB ने 68 स्वर्ण जीते, जिससे वे समग्र विजेता बने।

Additional Information

  • मल्लखंब और योगासन को शुरू में प्रदर्शन कार्यक्रमों के रूप में घोषित किया गया था, लेकिन बाद में उन्हें पूर्ण पदक खेलों में अपग्रेड किया गया।
  • शीर्ष टीमें:
    • SSCB: 121 पदक (68 स्वर्ण, 26 रजत, 27 कांस्य)
    • महाराष्ट्र: 201 पदक (54 स्वर्ण, 71 रजत, 76 कांस्य)
    • हरियाणा: 153 पदक (48 स्वर्ण, 47 रजत, 58 कांस्य)
  • अधिकांश खिताब: 1985 में खेलों के नवीनीकरण के बाद से, SSCB ने सबसे अधिक बार (5 खिताब) चैंपियनशिप जीती है।
  • शीर्ष एथलीट: ओलंपियन जैसे लोवलिना बोरगोहेन (मुक्केबाजी), तजिंदरपाल सिंह तोर (शॉट पुट), पारुल चौधरी (3000 मीटर स्टीपलचेज़) और अन्य ने भाग लिया।

125
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
नई दिल्ली में ‘जैविक प्रभाव अंतरिक्ष विकिरण, भारी आयनों और मानव अंतरिक्ष मिशन’ पर अंतर्राष्ट्रीय रेडियोबायोलॉजी सम्मेलन की मेज़बानी किस संगठन ने की है?
भारतीय अंतरिक्ष अनुसंधान संगठन (इसरो)
भारतीय चिकित्सा अनुसंधान परिषद (आईसीएमआर)
रक्षा अनुसंधान और विकास संगठन (डीआरडीओ)
नेशनल एरोनॉटिक्स एंड स्पेस एडमिनिस्ट्रेशन (नासा)
भारतीय कृषि अनुसंधान परिषद (ICAR)
Solution

सही उत्तर रक्षा अनुसंधान और विकास संगठन (डीआरडीओ) है।

समाचार में

  • नई दिल्ली में ‘जैविक प्रभाव अंतरिक्ष विकिरण, भारी आयनों और मानव अंतरिक्ष मिशन’ पर अंतर्राष्ट्रीय रेडियोबायोलॉजी सम्मेलन शुरू हुआ।
  • इसका उद्घाटन प्रधान वैज्ञानिक सलाहकार प्रोफेसर अजय कुमार सूद और डीआरडीओ के अध्यक्ष डॉ. समीर वी कामत ने किया।
  • यह आयोजन परमाणु चिकित्सा और संबद्ध विज्ञान संस्थान (आईएनएमएएस), डीआरडीओ के अधीन एक प्रयोगशाला द्वारा आयोजित किया गया है।

मुख्य बिंदु

  • सम्मेलन अंतरिक्ष विकिरण के जैविक प्रभावों और प्रतिवादों पर केंद्रित है।
  • इसका उद्देश्य बढ़ते अंतरिक्ष अन्वेषण और इसके स्वास्थ्य प्रभावों से संबंधित चुनौतियों का समाधान करना है।
  • विकिरण के जैविक प्रभावों को कम करने के लिए अंतर्राष्ट्रीय सहयोग पर बल दिया गया है।
  • इस आयोजन में भारत और विदेश के वैज्ञानिकों और डॉक्टरों की भागीदारी शामिल है।

अतिरिक्त जानकारी

  • परमाणु चिकित्सा और संबद्ध विज्ञान संस्थान (आईएनएमएएस)
    • आईएनएमएएस डीआरडीओ की एक प्रयोगशाला है जो परमाणु चिकित्सा और विकिरण संरक्षण में विशेषज्ञता रखती है।
    • यह विकिरण जोखिम और जैव चिकित्सा प्रतिवादों के प्रभावों पर शोध करती है।
  • अंतरिक्ष अनुसंधान में डीआरडीओ की भूमिका
    • डीआरडीओ रक्षा संबंधी अंतरिक्ष प्रौद्योगिकियों में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाता है।
    • यह अंतरिक्ष रक्षा पहलों के लिए इसरो और अन्य एजेंसियों के साथ सहयोग करता है।
  • अंतरिक्ष विकिरण और इसका प्रभाव
    • अंतरिक्ष विकिरण में ब्रह्मांडीय किरणें, सौर प्रस्फोट और भारी आयन शामिल हैं।
    • यह डीएनए क्षति, कैंसर के बढ़ते जोखिम और तंत्रिका संबंधी प्रभाव पैदा कर सकता है।
126
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
जनवरी 2025 में डिजिटल ऋण संचालन में अनियमितताओं के लिए RBI द्वारा किस गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनी (NBFC) का पंजीकरण रद्द कर दिया गया था?
इंडियाबुल्स कंज्यूमर फाइनेंस
X10 फाइनेंशियल सर्विसेज
बajaj फाइनेंस
इंडिया इन्फोलिन फाइनेंस
मुथूट फिनकॉर्प
Solution

सही उत्तर X10 फाइनेंशियल सर्विसेज है।

In News

  • जनवरी 2025 में, भारतीय रिज़र्व बैंक (RBI) ने मुंबई स्थित NBFC, X10 फाइनेंशियल सर्विसेज लिमिटेड के पंजीकरण प्रमाणपत्र (CoR) को रद्द कर दिया।
  • पहले अभिषेक सिक्योरिटीज लिमिटेड के नाम से जानी जाने वाली इस कंपनी ने डिजिटल ऋण दिशानिर्देशों का उल्लंघन किया।

Key Points

  • X10 फाइनेंशियल सर्विसेज मुंबई, महाराष्ट्र में स्थित एक गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनी (NBFC) है।
  • डिजिटल ऋण मानदंडों का पालन न करने के कारण RBI द्वारा इसका पंजीकरण प्रमाणपत्र रद्द कर दिया गया।
  • कंपनी ने ऋण मूल्यांकन, ब्याज दर निर्धारण और KYC जैसे महत्वपूर्ण कार्यों को बाहरी सेवा प्रदाताओं को आउटसोर्स किया।
  • ऐसी प्रथाएँ NBFC और डिजिटल ऋणदाताओं के लिए RBI के दिशानिर्देशों का उल्लंघन करती हैं।

Additional Information

  • RBI डिजिटल ऋण दिशानिर्देश
    • मूल ऋण कार्यों को आउटसोर्स करने पर रोक
    • विनियमित संस्थाओं के बैंक खातों के माध्यम से प्रत्यक्ष ऋण वितरण और भुगतान अनिवार्य
    • ब्याज दरों, शुल्कों और उधारकर्ता समझौतों में पारदर्शिता लागू करना
  • NBFC के बारे में
    • गैर-बैंकिंग वित्तीय कंपनियाँ बैंकों के समान वित्तीय सेवाएँ प्रदान करती हैं, लेकिन बैंकिंग लाइसेंस के बिना
    • RBI अधिनियम, 1934 के तहत भारतीय रिज़र्व बैंक द्वारा विनियमित
  • हालिया नियामक रुझान
    • RBI ने डिजिटल ऋण प्रथाओं की जांच तेज कर दी है
    • उधारकर्ता संरक्षण और परिचालन पारदर्शिता पर जोर
127
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s

मार्च 2025 में मंत्रिमंडल द्वारा अनुमोदित निम्नलिखित में से कौन सा/से कथन सही है/हैं?

  1. केंद्रीय मंत्रिमंडल ने संशोधित राष्ट्रीय डेयरी विकास कार्यक्रम (NPDD) को अतिरिक्त 1,000 करोड़ रुपये के साथ अनुमोदित किया, जिससे 15वें वित्त आयोग की अवधि के लिए कुल बजट 2,790 करोड़ रुपये हो गया।

  2. मंत्रिमंडल ने असम में 12.7 लाख मीट्रिक टन की वार्षिक क्षमता वाले एक नए ब्राउनफील्ड अमोनिया-यूरिया कॉम्प्लेक्स को 10,601.40 करोड़ रुपये की लागत से अनुमोदित किया।

  3. मंत्रिमंडल ने महाराष्ट्र में जवाहरलाल नेहरू पोर्ट अथॉरिटी (JNPA) पोर्ट को चौक से जोड़ने वाले 3-लेन वाले राष्ट्रीय राजमार्ग के निर्माण को अनुमोदित किया, जिसकी अनुमानित लागत 4,500.62 करोड़ रुपये है।

केवल 1 और 2
केवल 2
केवल 2 और 3
केवल 1 और 3
केवल 3
Solution

सही उत्तर केवल 1 और 2 है।

In News

  • प्रधान मंत्री नरेंद्र मोदी की अध्यक्षता में केंद्रीय मंत्रिमंडल ने संशोधित राष्ट्रीय डेयरी विकास कार्यक्रम (NPDD) को अतिरिक्त 1,000 करोड़ रुपये के साथ अनुमोदित किया, जिससे 15वें वित्त आयोग (FC) चक्र की अवधि के लिए कुल बजट 2,790 करोड़ रुपये हो गया।
  • उन्होंने असम में 12.7 लाख मीट्रिक टन की वार्षिक क्षमता वाले एक नए ब्राउनफील्ड अमोनिया-यूरिया कॉम्प्लेक्स को लगभग 10,601.40 करोड़ रुपये की अनुमानित लागत से भी अनुमोदित किया।
  • इसके अतिरिक्त, महाराष्ट्र में जवाहरलाल नेहरू पोर्ट अथॉरिटी (JNPA) पोर्ट को चौक से जोड़ने वाले एक ग्रीनफील्ड राष्ट्रीय राजमार्ग के निर्माण के प्रस्ताव को मंज़ूरी दी गई, लेकिन यह 6-लेन राजमार्ग है, 4-लेन नहीं।

Key Points

  • कथन 1 सही है: केंद्रीय मंत्रिमंडल ने 15वें वित्त आयोग चक्र के लिए अतिरिक्त 1,000 करोड़ रुपये के साथ संशोधित राष्ट्रीय डेयरी विकास कार्यक्रम (NPDD) को मंज़ूरी दी, जिससे कुल बजट 2,790 करोड़ रुपये हो गया।
  • कथन 2 सही है: असम के नामरूप में 12.7 लाख मीट्रिक टन की वार्षिक क्षमता वाला एक नया ब्राउनफील्ड अमोनिया-यूरिया कॉम्प्लेक्स लगभग 10,601.40 करोड़ रुपये की अनुमानित लागत से स्थापित किया जा रहा है।
  • कथन 3 गलत है: मंत्रिमंडल ने महाराष्ट्र में जवाहरलाल नेहरू पोर्ट अथॉरिटी (JNPA) पोर्ट को चौक से जोड़ने वाले 6-लेन राष्ट्रीय राजमार्ग के निर्माण को मंज़ूरी दी, 4-लेन नहीं, जिसकी अनुमानित लागत 4,500.62 करोड़ रुपये है।

Additional Information

  • अतिरिक्त अनुमोदन:
    • कम मूल्य वाले भारत इंटरफेस फॉर मनी- यूनिफाइड पेमेंट्स इंटरफेस (BHIM-UPI) लेनदेन व्यक्तियों से व्यापारी (P2M) के प्रचार के लिए प्रोत्साहन योजना, वित्तीय वर्ष 2024-25 (FY25) के लिए अनुमानित बजट 1,500 करोड़ रुपये है।
    • संशोधित राष्ट्रीय गोकुल मिशन (RGM), अतिरिक्त 1,000 करोड़ रुपये के साथ, 2021-22 से 2025-26 तक 15वें वित्त आयोग चक्र के दौरान कुल आवंटन 3,400 करोड़ रुपये हो गया।
    • असम के नामरूप में 12.7 लाख मीट्रिक टन (LMT) वार्षिक क्षमता वाले यूरिया उत्पादन के एक नए ब्राउनफील्ड अमोनिया-यूरिया कॉम्प्लेक्स की स्थापना, जिसकी कुल अनुमानित लागत 10,601.40 करोड़ रुपये है।
128
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
फ़रवरी 2025 में S&P ग्लोबल मार्केट इंटेलिजेंस के अनुसार, वित्त वर्ष 25 और वित्त वर्ष 26 के लिए भारत की अनुमानित सकल घरेलू उत्पाद (GDP) वृद्धि दर क्या है?
6.4%
6.2%
6.9%
6.8%
6.6%
Solution

सही उत्तर 6.4% है।

In News

  • S&P ग्लोबल मार्केट इंटेलिजेंस ने वित्त वर्ष 2024-25 (FY25) और FY26 दोनों के लिए भारत के सकल घरेलू उत्पाद में 6.4% की वृद्धि का अनुमान लगाया है।
  • यह अनुमान मौद्रिक और राजकोषीय प्रोत्साहन के अपेक्षित लाभों पर आधारित है, जो भारतीय अर्थव्यवस्था को बढ़ती वैश्विक चुनौतियों का समाधान करने में मदद करेगा।

Key Points

  • S&P ग्लोबल मार्केट इंटेलिजेंस ने FY25 और FY26 दोनों के लिए भारत के सकल घरेलू उत्पाद की वृद्धि दर 6.4% अनुमानित की है।
  • वृद्धि का अनुमान इस उम्मीद पर आधारित है कि मौद्रिक और राजकोषीय प्रोत्साहन वैश्विक बाजार में चुनौतियों का समाधान करने में मदद करेगा।
  • इस पूर्वानुमान के लिए वैश्विक आर्थिक परिस्थितियों और अंतर्राष्ट्रीय बाजारों में बढ़ती चुनौतियों को ध्यान में रखा गया है।

Additional Information

  • S&P ग्लोबल मार्केट इंटेलिजेंस
    • S&P ग्लोबल मार्केट इंटेलिजेंस वैश्विक बाजारों के लिए गहन वित्तीय विश्लेषण, डेटा और शोध प्रदान करता है।
    • इसे आर्थिक, बाजार और ऋण सूचना के स्रोत के रूप में व्यापक रूप से माना जाता है।
  • सकल घरेलू उत्पाद (GDP)
    • GDP किसी देश की सीमाओं के भीतर उत्पादित सभी वस्तुओं और सेवाओं के कुल मूल्य को मापता है।
    • यह किसी देश के आर्थिक स्वास्थ्य और विकास का एक प्राथमिक संकेतक है।
  • मौद्रिक और राजकोषीय प्रोत्साहन
    • मौद्रिक प्रोत्साहन में उधार और निवेश को प्रोत्साहित करने के लिए ब्याज दरों को कम करने जैसे उपाय शामिल हैं।
    • राजकोषीय प्रोत्साहन में आर्थिक गतिविधि को बढ़ावा देने के लिए बुनियादी ढांचे और कल्याणकारी कार्यक्रमों पर सरकारी व्यय शामिल है।
129
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
निम्नलिखित कथनों पर विचार करें:
कथन संख्या 1: भारत का पहला AI-संचालित डेबिट कार्ड विशेषज्ञ "Wisor" नाम का है।
कथन संख्या 2: यह विस्तृत व्यय विश्लेषण प्रदान करता है और उपयोगकर्ताओं को एक दृश्य में सभी कार्डों और व्यापारियों में अपने कार्ड व्यय को ट्रैक करने की अनुमति देता है।
कथन संख्या 3: CheQ, भारत की सबसे तेज़ी से बढ़ती फिनटेक कंपनी ने इसे लॉन्च किया है।
उपरोक्त में से कौन सा/से कथन सही है/हैं?
केवल कथन 1 सही है।
केवल कथन 1 और 2 सही हैं।
केवल कथन 2 और 3 सही हैं।
उपरोक्त सभी कथन सही हैं।
केवल कथन 2 सही है।
Solution

सही उत्तर है केवल कथन 2 और 3 सही हैं।

समाचार में

  • CheQ ने उपयोगकर्ता क्रेडिट कार्ड प्रबंधन को सरल बनाने के लिए भारत का पहला AI-संचालित क्रेडिट कार्ड विशेषज्ञ, Wisor लॉन्च किया है।

मुख्य बिंदु

  • कथन 1 गलत है: Wisor भारत का पहला AI-संचालित क्रेडिट कार्ड विशेषज्ञ है, डेबिट कार्ड विशेषज्ञ नहीं।
  • कथन 2 सही है: Wisor विस्तृत व्यय विश्लेषण प्रदान करता है, जिससे उपयोगकर्ता एक दृश्य में सभी कार्डों और व्यापारियों में व्यय को ट्रैक कर सकते हैं।
  • कथन 3 सही है: CheQ, भारत की सबसे तेज़ी से बढ़ती फिनटेक कंपनी ने Wisor लॉन्च किया है।
  • Wisor इस महीने CheQ द्वारा लॉन्च किए गए 7 नए उत्पादों में से एक है।

अतिरिक्त जानकारी

  • Wisor की विशेषताएँ:
    • व्यक्तिगत क्रेडिट विशेषज्ञ: त्वरित उत्तर के लिए एक सहज Q&A चैट इंटरफ़ेस।
    • स्मार्ट व्यय विश्लेषण: श्रेणियों में व्यय की विस्तृत ट्रैकिंग और विश्लेषण की अनुमति देता है।
    • इनामों को अधिकतम करना: यह क्रेडिट कार्ड इनामों, कैशबैक और लाभों में पारदर्शिता लाता है, जिससे उपयोगकर्ता उन्हें अनुकूलित कर सकते हैं।
  • CheQ:
    • एक पूर्व Flipkart कार्यकारी, आदित्य सोनी द्वारा स्थापित।
    • क्रेडिट कार्ड प्रबंधन को सरल बनाने पर केंद्रित भारत की सबसे तेज़ी से बढ़ती फिनटेक कंपनी।

130
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
2023 में __________ द्वारा आरम्भ किए गए राष्ट्रीय क्वांटम मिशन (NQM) का उद्देश्य क्वांटम कंप्यूटिंग के लिए IISc बेंगलुरु सहित चार विषयगत केंद्रों के माध्यम से क्वांटम प्रौद्योगिकी की शक्ति का दोहन करना है।
रक्षा मंत्रालय
विज्ञान एवं प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय
गृह मंत्रालय
शिक्षा मंत्रालय
नवीन एवं नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा मंत्रालय
Solution

सही उत्तर विज्ञान और प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय है।

In News 

  • क्वांटम प्रौद्योगिकियों के विकास को बढ़ावा देने के लिए विज्ञान और प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय द्वारा 2023 में राष्ट्रीय क्वांटम मिशन (NQM) आरम्भ किया गया था।

Key Points 

  • अभियान का उद्देश्य नवाचार को बढ़ावा देना, सुरक्षा को मजबूत करना और क्वांटम प्रौद्योगिकी का उपयोग करके विभिन्न उद्योगों को बढ़ावा देना है।
  • NQM का परिव्यय ₹6003.65 करोड़ है और इसे 2023-24 से 2030-31 तक क्रियान्वित किया जाएगा।
  • अभियान में चार विषयगत केंद्र हैं, जिनमें IISc बेंगलुरु क्वांटम कंप्यूटिंग पर ध्यान केंद्रित करेगा।
  • यह अभियान मुख्य क्षेत्रों पर ध्यान केंद्रित करता है: क्वांटम कंप्यूटिंग, क्वांटम संचार, क्वांटम सेंसिंग, तथा क्वांटम सामग्री एवं उपकरण।

Additional Information 

  • राष्ट्रीय क्वांटम मिशन (NQM) : विज्ञान और प्रौद्योगिकी मंत्रालय द्वारा 2023 में विभिन्न क्षेत्रों में क्वांटम प्रौद्योगिकियों को विकसित करने और लागू करने के लिए आरम्भ किया गया एक अभियान है।
  • क्वांटम कंप्यूटिंग : गणना करने के लिए सुपरपोजिशन और एन्टेंगलमेंट जैसी क्वांटम-मैकेनिकल घटनाओं का उपयोग।
  • IISc बेंगलुरु : बेंगलुरु स्थित भारतीय विज्ञान संस्थान, जो NQM के भाग के रूप में क्वांटम कंप्यूटिंग में अनुसंधान का नेतृत्व करता है।
  • क्वांटम संचार : सुरक्षित संचार प्रणालियों को सक्षम करने के लिए क्वांटम यांत्रिकी का उपयोग, NQM में IIT मद्रास द्वारा नेतृत्व किया गया।
131
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: In each of the questions below, three sentences are given that may or may not contain an error. Choose the one that is grammatically as well as contextually correct and meaningful. If all the sentences are correct, mark 'All are correct' as your answer.

A) Being a rainy day, we stayed indoors and watched movies.

B) Each of the students were given a set of questions to solve.

C) I have never seen such a beautiful sunset before.

Only B
Only A
A and C
Only C
All are correct

C) Unless he doesn’t apologize, she won’t forgive him.

135
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Direction: In each of the following questions, a sentence with a blank is given, followed by five words labeled (A), (B), (C), (D), and (E). Choose the word that cannot fill the blank appropriately in the context of the passage.

Does biology determine destiny, or is society the dominant cause of masculine and feminine traits? In this spirited exchange, the psychologist Cordelia Fine and the evolutionary biologist Carole Hooven unpack the complex relationship between testosterone and human behaviour.
Fine emphasises variability, flexibility and context – seeing gender as shaped by social forces as much as it is by ___________ (A). By contrast, Hooven stresses consistent patterns; while ___________ (B) the influence of culture and the differences between individuals, she maintains that biology explains why certain sex-linked behaviours persist across cultures.
At stake in this debate is how we understand ourselves and organise our communities. Can we achieve equality by changing cultural norms, or must we accommodate biological realities that evolution has inscribed in our brains? As you read, notice how these scholars interpret the same evidence through fundamentally different frameworks – revealing why discussions about sex differences remain both scientifically complex and politically charged.
Risk-taking, dominance, aggressive jostling for status – many of us are familiar with the idea that these masculine traits can be largely chalked-up to __________ (C). Take this description of the dangerous, male-dominated environment of an oil platform in the 1980s, where one worker compared his colleagues to ‘a pack of lions’:

The guy that was in charge was the one who could basically out-perform and out-shout and out-intimidate all the others. That’s just how it worked out here on drilling rigs and in production. So those people went to the top, over other people’s bodies in some cases. But then something changed. In the early 1990s, the company overhauled their policies and practices on the rig to enhance safety and effectiveness – and, in doing so, inadvertently created an environment that ‘___________ (D)’ these men from displays of masculinity. This unexpected effect was documented by the organisational scholars Robin Ely and Debra Meyerson, who observed the pattern play out on two offshore oil platforms. For the first time, workers started to __________ (E) their own physical limits, admit their mistakes, and discuss their own and others’ emotions. A deck mechanic sent a classical music tape home for a coworker’s baby, saying that ‘it’s real important for them babies to listen to music like that. Real soothing.’ When a researcher tipped his chair back in a meeting, he was politely told: ‘That’s not safe.’ Men openly displayed fear when evacuated after 9/11. ‘We are a very different group now than we were when we first got together – kinder, gentler people,’ one production operator said.

Which of the following words cannot fill blank (A) appropriately?
biology
hormones
physiological changes
organic forces
external

143
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

Which of the following statements regarding India’s efforts for Rana’s extradition is true, as per the passage?
India sought Rana's extradition immediately after the 2008 attack.
The process gained momentum after President Biden's visit to India.
The US Supreme Court permitted Rana’s stay in 2024.
India formally requested extradition in 2020 through the NIA.
Rana’s extradition was carried out despite US court objections.
144
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

Which of the following was not explicitly stated in the passage as an international terror group India and the US aim to fight?
Al Qaeda
Taliban
ISIS
Jaish-e-Mohammad
Lashkar-e-Taiba
145
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

Which of the following best states the central idea of the passage?
Rana’s extradition was a political gesture by the US.
India has successfully concluded its investigation into 26/11.
Tahawwur Rana’s extradition represents a legal and diplomatic win in India’s campaign against cross-border terrorism.
The US courts were biased in favour of Indian interests.
Rana’s connection to David Headley is the only reason for his arrest.
146
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

Choose the option in which the phrasal verb is not used correctly according to standard usage:
Rana was handed over to Indian authorities.
The legal process gathered momentum after 2020.
Kasab laid siege to India’s financial capital.
The extradition stood India out in good stead.
Rana ran out of legal options in the US.

English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

According to the passage, which of the following statements is/are correct?

A) Rana is a former army doctor from Pakistan.

B) India’s request for extradition was backed by the UN Security Council.

C) David Headley was arrested after Rana’s extradition.

Only A
Only B
A and B
A and C
B and C

English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

Which of the following statements is/are incorrect according to the passage?

A) Rana’s extradition case was delayed due to lack of legal support from India.

B) President Trump made the extradition announcement during PM Modi’s visit to India.

C) The passage claims that Pakistan aided India in prosecuting all accused.

Only A
Only C
A and C
A and B
All A, B and C

English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

List I (Individuals) List II (Descriptions)
A. Tahawwur Rana 1. Only terrorist among the 10 attackers to be caught alive
B. David Coleman Headley 2. Co-accused arrested in the US in connection with 26/11
C. Ajmal Kasab 3. Accused of helping orchestrate 26/11 attacks
D. Hafiz Saeed 4. Lashkar-e-Taiba operative based in Pakistan
A-1, B-2, C-3, D-4
A-3, B-2, C-1, D-4
A-4, B-3, C-1, D-2
A-3, B-1, C-2, D-4
A-2, B-3, C-1, D-4

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

C. The Indian government had no prior legal support when attempting to extradite Rana.

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

Tahawwur Rana’s extradition to India is a major breakthrough in the government’s efforts to bring perpetrators of the 26/11 terror attacks to justice. A Canadian national of Pakistani origin, Rana is accused of being a key cog in the terror machinery that masterminded the killing of 166 people on November 26, 2008, in Mumbai. He was arrested in the US about a year after the incident, along with David Coleman Headley, an American citizen, also of Pakistani origin. The investigation has unravelled key strands in the global terror network. At the same time, Indian intelligence agencies have gathered evidence for Rana’s role in 26/11 and Delhi has explored legal and diplomatic channels for the former Pakistani army doctor’s extradition, with the process gathering momentum after 2020, when the NIA made a formal request. On February 13, addressing a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter’s visit to the US, President Donald Trump announced that Rana would be handed over to Indian authorities. Rana exhausted all his legal options in the US on April 4 after the country’s Supreme Court denied his application seeking a stay on his deportation. His extradition is a major victory for the Indian government’s legal team that contested his double jeopardy argument in the US courts. By all accounts, India’s cordial relations with the US stood the country in good stead in navigating legal complexities and fast-tracking the extradition. So far, India has been able to prosecute Ajmal Kasab, one of the 10 heavily armed terrorists who laid siege to India’s financial capital for more than 60 horrifying hours. For the relatives of those who lost their lives in one of the worst transnational terror attacks in recent history, closure has seemed elusive with Islamabad consistently denying assistance to New Delhi in prosecuting Hafiz Saeed, Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi and other Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) operatives based in the country. Now, Rana’s interrogation could help the probe agencies expose the role of the Pakistani state and non-state actors behind the heinous attacks. The probe could strengthen India’s case against Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on the global stage, including at forums like the UN Security Council. The Indo-US joint statement after PM Modi’s visit to the US notes, “the two countries are committed to strengthening cooperation against terrorist threats from groups, including al Qaeda, ISIS, Jaish-e Mohammad, and LeT to prevent heinous acts like the Mumbai attacks”. Efforts to secure the world against terror are the best tribute to those who lost their lives on November 26, 2008. Rana’s extradition is an important step towards this goal.

C. India’s legal team successfully argued against Rana’s double jeopardy defense in the US courts.

Below are given some sentences out of which the sentence numbered 4 has been correctly placed. The rest of the sentences A, B, C, D, E, F need to be arranged correctly in order to form a logical order.

A. Dark matter is assumed to be non-baryonic in form, probably being composed of some as-yet-undiscovered subatomic particles. 

B. Dark matter is called dark because it does not interact with observable electromagnetic radiation, such as light, and is thus invisible to the entire electromagnetic spectrum, making it almost impossible to detect using normal astronomical equipment.

C. The primary evidence for dark matter is that calculations show that many galaxies would fly apart instead of rotating, or would not have formed or move as they do if they did not contain a large amount of unseen or dark matter.

4. One can safely assume that the primary characteristic of dark matter is some new kind of elementary particle that has not yet been discovered, and which interacts weakly with massive particles.

D. Dark matter is a form of matter that is found in galaxies and is thought to account for most of the matter in the universe and about 25% of its total energy density.

E. For this reason, most experts think dark matter to be abundant in the universe and to have had a strong influence on its structure and composition.

F. Its presence is implied in a variety of astrophysical observations, including gravitational effects that cannot be explained by accepted theories of gravity unless more matter is present than can be seen.

Which of the following is the FIRST statement?

D
F
E
C
B

Below are given some sentences out of which the sentence numbered 4 has been correctly placed. The rest of the sentences A, B, C, D, E, F need to be arranged correctly in order to form a logical order.

A. Dark matter is assumed to be non-baryonic in form, probably being composed of some as-yet-undiscovered subatomic particles. 

B. Dark matter is called dark because it does not interact with observable electromagnetic radiation, such as light, and is thus invisible to the entire electromagnetic spectrum, making it almost impossible to detect using normal astronomical equipment.

C. The primary evidence for dark matter is that calculations show that many galaxies would fly apart instead of rotating, or would not have formed or move as they do if they did not contain a large amount of unseen or dark matter.

4. One can safely assume that the primary characteristic of dark matter is some new kind of elementary particle that has not yet been discovered, and which interacts weakly with massive particles.

D. Dark matter is a form of matter that is found in galaxies and is thought to account for most of the matter in the universe and about 25% of its total energy density.

E. For this reason, most experts think dark matter to be abundant in the universe and to have had a strong influence on its structure and composition.

F. Its presence is implied in a variety of astrophysical observations, including gravitational effects that cannot be explained by accepted theories of gravity unless more matter is present than can be seen.

A

A. Dark matter is assumed to be non-baryonic in form, probably being composed of some as-yet-undiscovered subatomic particles. 

B. Dark matter is called dark because it does not interact with observable electromagnetic radiation, such as light, and is thus invisible to the entire electromagnetic spectrum, making it almost impossible to detect using normal astronomical equipment.

C. The primary evidence for dark matter is that calculations show that many galaxies would fly apart instead of rotating, or would not have formed or move as they do if they did not contain a large amount of unseen or dark matter.

English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Below are given some sentences out of which the sentence numbered 4 has been correctly placed. The rest of the sentences A, B, C, D, E, F need to be arranged correctly in order to form a logical order.

A. Dark matter is assumed to be non-baryonic in form, probably being composed of some as-yet-undiscovered subatomic particles. 

B. Dark matter is called dark because it does not interact with observable electromagnetic radiation, such as light, and is thus invisible to the entire electromagnetic spectrum, making it almost impossible to detect using normal astronomical equipment.

C. The primary evidence for dark matter is that calculations show that many galaxies would fly apart instead of rotating, or would not have formed or move as they do if they did not contain a large amount of unseen or dark matter.

4. One can safely assume that the primary characteristic of dark matter is some new kind of elementary particle that has not yet been discovered, and which interacts weakly with massive particles.

D. Dark matter is a form of matter that is found in galaxies and is thought to account for most of the matter in the universe and about 25% of its total energy density.

E. For this reason, most experts think dark matter to be abundant in the universe and to have had a strong influence on its structure and composition.

F. Its presence is implied in a variety of astrophysical observations, including gravitational effects that cannot be explained by accepted theories of gravity unless more matter is present than can be seen.

Which of the following is the SEVENTH statement?

D
F
E
C
B
162
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

For over fifteen centuries, the Silk Road, a sprawling network of trade routes stretching from the eastern shores of Asia to the Mediterranean Sea, served as the lifeblood of intercultural exchange. More than just a conduit for silk, spices, and precious metals, it facilitated the transmission of ideas, religions, technologies, and even diseases, shaping the destinies of empires and civilizations. From the bustling markets of Chang'an to the vibrant ports of Constantinople, a complex web of merchants, artisans, monks, and adventurers traversed treacherous terrains, forging connections that transcended geographical boundaries. The zenith of the Silk Road era spanned roughly from the Han Dynasty in China (206 BCE - 220 CE) to the Mongol Empire (13th-14th centuries). During this period, powerful empires along the route provided relative stability and security, fostering trade and cultural diffusion. Buddhism, originating in India, spread eastward along these pathways, leaving an indelible mark on East Asian societies. Islamic scholarship and scientific advancements flowed westward, enriching the intellectual landscape of Europe. Chinese inventions like paper and gunpowder gradually made their way across the continents, revolutionizing communication and warfare.
However, the intricate tapestry of the Silk Road began to unravel in the late mediaeval period. Several factors contributed to its gradual decline. The fragmentation of large empires, such as the Mongol Empire, disrupted the established trade networks and increased insecurity. The rise of powerful maritime powers in Europe, particularly Portugal and Spain, led to the exploration of sea routes to Asia. Vasco da Gama's voyage to India in 1498, circumnavigating Africa, offered a faster and potentially cheaper alternative to the arduous overland journey. The focus of global trade gradually shifted from land-based routes to oceanic ones. European powers established direct sea connections with the East, bypassing the traditional intermediaries along the Silk Road. This shift in trade dynamics had profound consequences for the regions and cities that had once thrived along the Silk Road. Inland trading centres lost their prominence, and the economic and political power shifted towards the coastal nations of Europe. While the Silk Road as a dominant global trade artery faded, its legacy endures. The historical interactions fostered along these routes left an indelible mark on the cultural, linguistic, and genetic makeup of the regions they connected. The memory of its vibrant past continues to inspire scholarly inquiry and reminds us of ______________ on the course of human history. The modern "Belt and Road Initiative" launched by China can even be seen as a contemporary echo, albeit on a vastly different scale and nature, of the ancient pathways that once connected East and West.
According to the passage, which of the following was a key factor in the decline of the Silk Road during the late mediaeval period?
The spread of Buddhism across Asia
The rise of powerful maritime powers in Europe
The expansion of the Mongol Empire
The invention of gunpowder
The establishment of direct land routes to Europe
163
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

The modern "Belt and Road Initiative" launched by China can even be seen as a contemporary echo, albeit on a vastly different scale and nature, of the ancient pathways that once connected East and West.
The passage states that the zenith of the Silk Road era spanned roughly from:
The fall of the Roman Empire to the rise of the Mongol Empire
The Han Dynasty to the Roman Empire
The Han Dynasty to the Mongol Empire
The Gupta Empire to the Ming Dynasty
The rise of the Mongol Empire to the decline of the Ottoman Empire

For over fifteen centuries, the Silk Road, a sprawling network of trade routes stretching from the eastern shores of Asia to the Mediterranean Sea, served as the lifeblood of intercultural exchange. More than just a conduit for silk, spices, and precious metals, it facilitated the transmission of ideas, religions, technologies, and even diseases, shaping the destinies of empires and civilizations. From the bustling markets of Chang'an to the vibrant ports of Constantinople, a complex web of merchants, artisans, monks, and adventurers traversed treacherous terrains, forging connections that transcended geographical boundaries. The zenith of the Silk Road era spanned roughly from the Han Dynasty in China (206 BCE - 220 CE) to the Mongol Empire (13th-14th centuries). During this period, powerful empires along the route provided relative stability and security, fostering trade and cultural diffusion. Buddhism, originating in India, spread eastward along these pathways, leaving an indelible mark on East Asian societies. Islamic scholarship and scientific advancements flowed westward, enriching the intellectual landscape of Europe. Chinese inventions like paper and gunpowder gradually made their way across the continents, revolutionizing communication and warfare.
However, the intricate tapestry of the Silk Road began to unravel in the late mediaeval period. Several factors contributed to its gradual decline. The fragmentation of large empires, such as the Mongol Empire, disrupted the established trade networks and increased insecurity. The rise of powerful maritime powers in Europe, particularly Portugal and Spain, led to the exploration of sea routes to Asia. Vasco da Gama's voyage to India in 1498, circumnavigating Africa, offered a faster and potentially cheaper alternative to the arduous overland journey. The focus of global trade gradually shifted from land-based routes to oceanic ones. European powers established direct sea connections with the East, bypassing the traditional intermediaries along the Silk Road. This shift in trade dynamics had profound consequences for the regions and cities that had once thrived along the Silk Road. Inland trading centres lost their prominence, and the economic and political power shifted towards the coastal nations of Europe. While the Silk Road as a dominant global trade artery faded, its legacy endures. The historical interactions fostered along these routes left an indelible mark on the cultural, linguistic, and genetic makeup of the regions they connected. The memory of its vibrant past continues to inspire scholarly inquiry and reminds us of ______________ on the course of human history. The modern "Belt and Road Initiative" launched by China can even be seen as a contemporary echo, albeit on a vastly different scale and nature, of the ancient pathways that once connected East and West.
What will fit in the blank taken from the passage: "The historical interactions fostered along these routes left an indelible mark on the cultural, linguistic, and genetic makeup of the regions they connected. The memory of its vibrant past continues to inspire scholarly inquiry and reminds us of ____________ on the course of human history."
the tremendous challenges faced
the profound impact of intercultural exchange
the devastating effects of disease
the economic success of global trade
the technological advances in transportation

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

For over fifteen centuries, the Silk Road, a sprawling network of trade routes stretching from the eastern shores of Asia to the Mediterranean Sea, served as the lifeblood of intercultural exchange. More than just a conduit for silk, spices, and precious metals, it facilitated the transmission of ideas, religions, technologies, and even diseases, shaping the destinies of empires and civilizations. From the bustling markets of Chang'an to the vibrant ports of Constantinople, a complex web of merchants, artisans, monks, and adventurers traversed treacherous terrains, forging connections that transcended geographical boundaries. The zenith of the Silk Road era spanned roughly from the Han Dynasty in China (206 BCE - 220 CE) to the Mongol Empire (13th-14th centuries). During this period, powerful empires along the route provided relative stability and security, fostering trade and cultural diffusion. Buddhism, originating in India, spread eastward along these pathways, leaving an indelible mark on East Asian societies. Islamic scholarship and scientific advancements flowed westward, enriching the intellectual landscape of Europe. Chinese inventions like paper and gunpowder gradually made their way across the continents, revolutionizing communication and warfare.
However, the intricate tapestry of the Silk Road began to unravel in the late mediaeval period. Several factors contributed to its gradual decline. The fragmentation of large empires, such as the Mongol Empire, disrupted the established trade networks and increased insecurity. The rise of powerful maritime powers in Europe, particularly Portugal and Spain, led to the exploration of sea routes to Asia. Vasco da Gama's voyage to India in 1498, circumnavigating Africa, offered a faster and potentially cheaper alternative to the arduous overland journey. The focus of global trade gradually shifted from land-based routes to oceanic ones. European powers established direct sea connections with the East, bypassing the traditional intermediaries along the Silk Road. This shift in trade dynamics had profound consequences for the regions and cities that had once thrived along the Silk Road. Inland trading centres lost their prominence, and the economic and political power shifted towards the coastal nations of Europe. While the Silk Road as a dominant global trade artery faded, its legacy endures. The historical interactions fostered along these routes left an indelible mark on the cultural, linguistic, and genetic makeup of the regions they connected. The memory of its vibrant past continues to inspire scholarly inquiry and reminds us of ______________ on the course of human history. The modern "Belt and Road Initiative" launched by China can even be seen as a contemporary echo, albeit on a vastly different scale and nature, of the ancient pathways that once connected East and West.

Sarcastic
Nostalgic and reflective
Critical and judgmental
Informative and objective
Optimistic and hopeful

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

For over fifteen centuries, the Silk Road, a sprawling network of trade routes stretching from the eastern shores of Asia to the Mediterranean Sea, served as the lifeblood of intercultural exchange. More than just a conduit for silk, spices, and precious metals, it facilitated the transmission of ideas, religions, technologies, and even diseases, shaping the destinies of empires and civilizations. From the bustling markets of Chang'an to the vibrant ports of Constantinople, a complex web of merchants, artisans, monks, and adventurers traversed treacherous terrains, forging connections that transcended geographical boundaries. The zenith of the Silk Road era spanned roughly from the Han Dynasty in China (206 BCE - 220 CE) to the Mongol Empire (13th-14th centuries). During this period, powerful empires along the route provided relative stability and security, fostering trade and cultural diffusion. Buddhism, originating in India, spread eastward along these pathways, leaving an indelible mark on East Asian societies. Islamic scholarship and scientific advancements flowed westward, enriching the intellectual landscape of Europe. Chinese inventions like paper and gunpowder gradually made their way across the continents, revolutionizing communication and warfare.
However, the intricate tapestry of the Silk Road began to unravel in the late mediaeval period. Several factors contributed to its gradual decline. The fragmentation of large empires, such as the Mongol Empire, disrupted the established trade networks and increased insecurity. The rise of powerful maritime powers in Europe, particularly Portugal and Spain, led to the exploration of sea routes to Asia. Vasco da Gama's voyage to India in 1498, circumnavigating Africa, offered a faster and potentially cheaper alternative to the arduous overland journey. The focus of global trade gradually shifted from land-based routes to oceanic ones. European powers established direct sea connections with the East, bypassing the traditional intermediaries along the Silk Road. This shift in trade dynamics had profound consequences for the regions and cities that had once thrived along the Silk Road. Inland trading centres lost their prominence, and the economic and political power shifted towards the coastal nations of Europe. While the Silk Road as a dominant global trade artery faded, its legacy endures. The historical interactions fostered along these routes left an indelible mark on the cultural, linguistic, and genetic makeup of the regions they connected. The memory of its vibrant past continues to inspire scholarly inquiry and reminds us of ______________ on the course of human history. The modern "Belt and Road Initiative" launched by China can even be seen as a contemporary echo, albeit on a vastly different scale and nature, of the ancient pathways that once connected East and West.

Dangerous
Straightforward
Smooth
Stable
